---
source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/WebKit/WKWebsiteDataStore
crawled: 2025-12-05T07:29:04Z
---

# WKWebsiteDataStore

**Class**

An object that manages cookies, disk and memory caches, and other types of data for a web view.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class WKWebsiteDataStore
```

## Overview

Use a [doc://com.apple.webkit/documentation/WebKit/WKWebsiteDataStore] object to configure and manage web site data. Specifically, use this object to:

- Manage cookies that your web site uses
- Learn about the types of data that websites store
- Remove unwanted web site data

Create a data store object and assign it to the [doc://com.apple.webkit/documentation/WebKit/WKWebViewConfiguration/websiteDataStore] property of a [doc://com.apple.webkit/documentation/WebKit/WKWebViewConfiguration] object before you create your web view.

By default, `WKWebViewConfiguration` uses the default data store returned by the [doc://com.apple.webkit/documentation/WebKit/WKWebsiteDataStore/default()] method, which saves website data persistently to disk.

To implement private browsing, create a nonpersistent data store using the [doc://com.apple.webkit/documentation/WebKit/WKWebsiteDataStore/nonPersistent()] method instead.

To implement profile browsing, create a persistent data store using the [doc://com.apple.webkit/documentation/WebKit/WKWebsiteDataStore/init(forIdentifier:)] method, passing an identifier that you use to identify the data store.

## Creating a data store object

- **default()**: Returns the default data store, which stores data persistently to disk.
- **nonPersistent()**: Creates a new data store object that stores website data in memory, and doesn’t write that data to disk.
- **init(forIdentifier:)**: Returns the persistent data store with the unique identifier you provide.

## Finding data stores

- **fetchAllDataStoreIdentifiers(_:)**: Fetches an array of identifiers from existing data stores that have identifiers.

## Inspecting data store properties

- **identifier**: An identifier that uniquely identifies a data store.
- **isPersistent**: A Boolean value that indicates whether this object stores data to disk.

## Retrieving a cookie store

- **httpCookieStore**: The object that manages the HTTP cookies for your website.

## Retrieving specific types of data

- **fetchDataRecords(ofTypes:completionHandler:)**: Fetches the specified types of records from the data store.
- **allWebsiteDataTypes()**: Returns the set of all the available data types.

## Removing specific types of data

- **removeData(ofTypes:for:completionHandler:)**: Removes the specified types of website data from one or more data records.
- **removeData(ofTypes:modifiedSince:completionHandler:)**: Removes website data that changed after the specified date.

## Removing a data store

- **remove(forIdentifier:completionHandler:)**: Removes the data store that matches the identifier you provide.

## Instance Properties

- **proxyConfigurations**

## Instance Methods

- **fetchData(of:completionHandler:)**
- **restoreData(_:completionHandler:)**

## Web data management

- **WKWebsiteDataRecord**: A record of the data that a particular website stores persistently.
- **WKHTTPCookieStore**: An object that manages the HTTP cookies associated with a particular web view.
- **WKURLSchemeHandler**: A protocol for loading resources with URL schemes that WebKit doesn’t handle.
- **WKURLSchemeTask**: An interface that WebKit uses to request custom resources from your app.
- **readAccessURL**: The local files WebKit can access when loading content.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCoding
- NSObjectProtocol
- NSSecureCoding
- Sendable
